title: How to Adjust a Ford EcoSport Seat

steps.title: Pull on the side lever several times to lift the front seats.
steps.content: Pull on the side lever several times to lift the front seats. Feel along the side of your seat that’s closest to the car door and look for a large handle. Grip the handle tightly and lift it up several times, which boosts your seat height. [1] X Research source It’s easiest to adjust your seat while you’re sitting in it.

steps.title: Lower the front seat by pushing down multiple times on the side lever.
steps.content: Lower the front seat by pushing down multiple times on the side lever. Grip the lever along the side of your seat and push it down several times. You may need to pump the lever several times before you’re happy with the adjustment. [2] X Research source This lever won’t do super dramatic adjustments, but it can come handy if your seat feels too high or low.

steps.title: Recline or tilt the front seats forward by using the side triangular lever.
steps.content: Recline or tilt the front seats forward by using the side triangular lever. Search along the side of your seat that’s closest to the car door and feel around for a small, triangular lever. Pull upwards on this lever to lean your seat backward or forward, depending on what’s most comfortable for you. [3] X Research source This lever is set farther back than the handle used to adjust the height on your seat.

steps.title: Lift the bar under the seat to slide it forward or back.
steps.content: Lift the bar under the seat to slide it forward or back. Feel beneath the front of your seat for a thin, rectangular metal bar. Pull upwards on this bar to unlock your seat and roll it forwards or backward. Once you’re happy with your new seat position, release the bar to lock your seat into place. [4] X Research source You should hear a clicking sound once your seat locks in place.

steps.title: Press on the button along the left and right sides of the seat.
steps.content: Press on the button along the left and right sides of the seat. Look to the left or right of your back headrests for a large, rectangular button. Press down on this button to unlock your seats so you can fold them forward. [5] X Research source The button to lower the right seat is on the right side, while the button to lower the left and center seats is on the left. Check that the headrests are locked in place and pushed down before you continue.

steps.title: Bring the seats forward to give yourself more cargo space.
steps.content: Bring the seats forward to give yourself more cargo space. Grip the top sections of the rear seats and pull the backrest down completely. The seats won’t be perfectly flat, but try to pull each seat down as far as they will go. [7] X Research source The seats should move pretty fluidly once they’re unlocked.

steps.title: Lift the seats back to their original position until you hear a click.
steps.content: Lift the seats back to their original position until you hear a click. Use both hands to push the seats back to their original, upright position. Listen until you hear a clicking sound, which means the seat is secure and locked in place. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Unlock and lift the headrest to adjust it.
steps.content: Unlock and lift the headrest to adjust it. Look at the mounts connecting the headrest to the front seat and search for 2 locking buttons. Press both of these buttons at the same time to either lift or lower your headrest to a comfortable position. [9] X Research source You need to press down both locking buttons at the same time, or else the headrest won’t adjust correctly.

steps.title: Pull on the rear headrest to lift it up.
steps.content: Pull on the rear headrest to lift it up. Place both hands beneath the headrest and firmly tug to lift it up. You don’t need to press down any locking buttons to do this. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Press the locking button to bring your rear headrest down.
steps.content: Press the locking button to bring your rear headrest down. Look along the right mounting pole of your headrest to find a locking button. Press this button in, then push down on the headrest to adjust it to your desired level. [11] X Research source
